page.title: 05ERSKINE BRIDGE
page.content: For centuries there had been a{ferry across the river Clyde at Erskine, but the ever{increasing growth of traffic made the building of the bridge, which was{completed in July 1971 very {necessary. The bridge and its approach roads provide an important{North South connection over the{Clyde}estuary between the A82 and the A8, carrying heavy commuter traffic between{Glasgow and the{Loch Lomond}area and connects with the Northern ringroads round Glasgow. On the south side, the road system serves Glasgow's{international airport {at Abbotsinch,}on the south bank of the Clydeside and connects with several trunk roads to the south. The bridge thus forms an{essential road {link}for all{future developments.
